panels.description: Active VMs with CPU, Memory or Thin Provisioning utilization peaks that are below their respective lower thresholds are listed as over-provisioned. Values indicating over- provisioning are highlighted.

targets.rawSql:
with vms_by_cluster as (
    select distinct on (e.oid) g.name as cluster_name, e.oid as vm_oid, e.name as vm_name
	from entity g
	join entity e on g."type" = 'COMPUTE_HOST_CLUSTER' and
	     array[g.oid] <@ e.scope
	     and e."type" = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' and e.state = 'POWERED_ON'
	     and (e.first_seen, e.last_seen) overlaps ($__timeFrom(),$__timeTo()))
select max(cluster_name) as "Cluster name",
       max(vm_name) as "VM name",
       AVG(metric.capacity) filter (where metric.type = 'VMEM') as "VMEM Capacity",
       AVG(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VMEM') as "VMEM Avg",
       max(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VMEM') as "VMEM Peak",
       AVG(metric.capacity) filter (where metric.type = 'VCPU') as "VCPU Capacity",
       AVG(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VCPU') as "VCPU Avg",
       max(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VCPU') as "VCPU Peak"
from vms_by_cluster
join metric on
       metric.entity_oid = vm_oid and 
       metric."type" in ('VMEM', 'VCPU') and provider_oid isnull and $__timeFilter(metric."time")
group by vm_oid
having max(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VMEM') < 0.1 OR
       max(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VCPU') < 0.1

panels.title: Over-provisioned VMs

panels.description: Active VMs with CPU, Memory or Thin Provisioning utilization averages that are above their respective upper thresholds are shown as under-provisioned in at least one of these aspects. Values indicating under-provisioning are highlighted.

targets.rawSql:
with vms_by_cluster as (
    select distinct on (e.oid) g.name as cluster_name, e.oid as vm_oid, e.name as vm_name
	from entity g
	join entity e on g."type" = 'COMPUTE_HOST_CLUSTER' and
	     array[g.oid] <@ e.scope
	     and e."type" = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' and e.state = 'POWERED_ON'
	     and (e.first_seen, e.last_seen) overlaps ($__timeFrom(),$__timeTo()))
select max(cluster_name) as "Cluster name",
       max(vm_name) as "VM name",
       AVG(metric.capacity) filter (where metric.type = 'VMEM') as "VMEM Capacity",
       AVG(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VMEM') as "VMEM Avg",
       max(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VMEM') as "VMEM Peak",
       AVG(metric.capacity) filter (where metric.type = 'VCPU') as "VCPU Capacity",
       AVG(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VCPU') as "VCPU Avg",
       max(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VCPU') as "VCPU Peak"
from vms_by_cluster
join metric on
       metric.entity_oid = vm_oid and 
       metric."type" in ('VMEM', 'VCPU') and provider_oid isnull and $__timeFilter(metric."time")
group by vm_oid
having max(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VMEM') > 0.85 OR
       max(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VCPU') > 0.85

panels.title: Under-provisioned VMs

panels.description: Group/Cluster information allowing individual VM peaks to be compared with the average of all of the peaks of the VMs in their corresponding cluster.

targets.rawSql:
with vms_by_cluster as (
  select distinct on(e.oid) g.name as cluster_name, e.oid as vm_oid
	from entity g
	join entity e on g."type" = 'COMPUTE_HOST_CLUSTER' and array[g.oid] <@ e.scope and e."type" = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE'
	  				and e."type" = 'VIRTUAL_MACHINE' and e.state = 'POWERED_ON'
	  				and (e.first_seen, e.last_seen) overlaps ($__timeFrom(),$__timeTo())),
vm_peaks as (
    SELECT MAX(cluster_name) as cluster_name,
	       MAX(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VMEM') as vmem_peak,
	       MAX(metric.utilization) filter (where metric.type = 'VCPU') as vcpu_peak
	FROM vms_by_cluster
	join metric on vm_oid = metric.entity_oid 
	      and $__timeFilter(metric."time")
	      and metric."type" in ('VMEM', 'VCPU')
	      and provider_oid isnull
	group by vm_oid)
select cluster_name as "Cluster", avg(vcpu_peak) as "Avg(Peak VCPU)", avg(vmem_peak) as "Avg(Peak VMem)"
from vm_peaks
group by cluster_name

panels.title: Clusters with Average Peaks
